channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What Kamala Harris is doing right—and wrong—in the lead-up to Election Day, according to former Press Sec. Jen Psaki
item.description: Harris has to appeal to Biden fans in the Democratic base, the MSNBC host and Obama and Biden administration alum says.

item.title: Uruguay’s 2024 Election: Candidates, Issues and Predictions
item.description: Crime, child poverty and an aging population are top issues as voters in one of Latin America’s most stable democracies head to the polls on Sunday.

item.title: Harris and Trump Deadlocked to the End, Final Times/Siena National Poll Finds
item.description: The electorate has rarely seemed so evenly divided. The latest New York Times/Siena College poll found Harris and Trump tied 48 to 48.

item.title: Canada’s Sikh Communities Have Been Rocked by Violence. Authorities Blame India.
item.description: Tightly knit communities in Ontario and British Columbia have been rocked by violent events in the past 18 months. Now the authorities say the Indian ...

item.title: Attacks on L.G.B.T.Q. People in Ivory Coast Shake Sense of Security
item.description: One of West Africa’s most tolerant societies has recently seen a string of assaults on L.G.B.T.Q. people after several social media influencers exhort...

item.title: Bosses are engaging in ‘subtle sabotage’ and giving their employees ‘office housework’. Here’s how to spot workplace gaslighting
item.description: Bosses are engaging in subtle forms of bullying to control their employeees, and giving them 'office housework' to undermine them.

item.title: Boeing workers’ anger over lost pensions behind vote to continue 6-week machinists strike
item.description: Boeing demanded in 2013 that machinists drop their pension plan as part of an agreement to build a new model of the 777 jetliner in Washington state.

item.title: What to Know About the Looming Election Certification Crisis
item.description: An investigation in four battleground states found that Republicans have taken control of election boards with the aim of challenging and overturning ...

item.title: U.S. and Qatar Say Gaza Cease-Fire Talks Will Resume, but Offer Few Details
item.description: Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken said U.S. and Qatari negotiators would soon restart long-stalled negotiations, but that it remained unclear if Ha...

item.title: The ‘Greenest Governor’ Fights to Save a Landmark Climate Law
item.description: Environmentalists and one of the world’s biggest oil companies support Washington State’s cap on carbon. But voters are deciding whether to repeal the...

item.title: Europe’s ‘mindset’ problem
item.description: Too many business leaders' ambitions don’t reach further than national or European scale at most.

item.title: Dan Osborn Is Building a Model for Taking on Republicans in Red States
item.description: Nebraska’s Senate race is far closer than anyone predicted.

item.title: Trump allies want to privatize Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac—but some economists warn it would make mortgages pricier
item.description: If Donald Trump wins the presidential election, Republicans hope he will fulfill a longstanding GOP goal of privatizing the mortgage giants Fannie Mae...

item.title: Israeli Strike Kills 3 Journalists, Lebanon’s Health Ministry Says
item.description: The three worked for Lebanese news organizations, their employers said. The ministry said they had been staying in a residence housing journalists.

item.title: Could Trump Win the Popular Vote but Lose the Electoral College?
item.description: It’s not likely, but it’s not something that can be completely dismissed either, recent polling suggests.
